page.title: 07Heritage Coast
page.content: The area that we studied falls under the Glamorgan Heritage Coast.This is an area of coastline selected for its natural beauty,which stretches from Aberthaw in the east, to Newton in the west, and extends a mile inland.Now that most people drive cars,the coast of Britain is invaded by millions of holiday makers every year.To protect and preserve the coast,certain areas of it were designated heritage coast areas. The Glamorgan coast was the first to be opened in 1973.Certain points on the coast were opened up and improved and people were encouraged to go there by the opening of large car parks and footpaths.This would leave other areas with certain rare flowers and animals free from human interference.They are patrolled by wardens and most of the work is done by volunteers.
